Typically, our students and staff dress in traditional colonial clothing and participate in a ceremony that consists of songs, speeches, and a dance performance by our fifth graders. The staff of The Crooked Billet-Hallowell Learning Community has created a video for this year‚Äôs Crooked Billet Day celebration. With spring just around the corner, the District is looking with anticipation toward the opening of the new Crooked Billet Elementary School in the fall of 2020. This state-of-art building will have the capacity to serve 600 of our students.

With this new school‚Äôs completion on the horizon, it is time to consider the possibility of closing Pennypack Elementary School, a beloved but aging building, and merging the attendance area with Crooked Billet Elementary School.

A vote on the future of Pennypack will occur 90 days after the hearing, as required by state law.

Please consider joining us on February 25.

You can also preview some of Dr. Troxell's information on YouTube and Ted Talks.

We hope to see you there!

Novelist Terry Pratchet once wrote, ‚ÄúThe thing about football - the important thing about football - is that it is not just about football.‚Äù At Hatboro-Horsham we know that behind every great game is a team of dedicated individuals.

Over the past five days, two Hatters players have been injured on the field ‚Äì causing great concern and stress among fellow team members and coaches alike.

Recognizing that the health and wellbeing of the team must take precedent over cordial play, Hatboro-Horsham has cancelled its game against Germantown Academy for Friday, October 4. This was a non-league, non-PIAA game. While our players had been enthusiastic about playing against GA, they are still bearing the stress of witnessing two teammate injuries in the past 5 days. As a community, we believe our players need this time to heal.

We thank Hatters fans for their support and understanding and look forward to seeing them in the bleachers during a future game.

Sincerely,

Dennis Williams, Principal
Louis F. James, Director of Athletics
